intro: Laplacea inaequalilatera, commonly known as the unequal-sided laplacea, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Laplacea inaequalilatera is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
